Science Community Workshop

The meeting will be held at the Royal Observatory of Edinburgh on 7th September 2017. It will run from 10:30am to 17:00pm, and include both talks and extensive discussion time. You can find directions to the ROE in: location

Registration is now closed

Developments towards the Square Kilometre Array (SKA) Observatory continue with pace. The on-going cost control project, the planning and development of Regional Processing Centres, and the UK Radio Astronomy Review instigated by STFC's Science Board, all have potentially significant implications for UK scientists aiming to exploit the transformational capabilities of the SKA. This meeting will provide an opportunity for the UK community to keep up-to-date with developments, review the UK's strategic priorities, and discuss how best to achieve these.

Programme

Meeting programme

  • 10:30-11:00Coffee
  • 11:00-11:20Robert Braun: "SKA Status and Capability Update"
  • 11:20-11:40Discussion (Cost control plans; UK SKA priorities)
  • 11:40-12:00Jane Greaves: "Pathfinder Science on Planet Formation and the Cradle of Life"
  • 12:00-12:20Suman Majumdar: "EoR 21-cm upper limits from LOFAR and a study of the signal non-Gaussianity through bispectrum"
  • 12:20-12:40Philip Best: "The LOFAR Two-Metre Sky Survey (LoTSS): status and opportunities"
  • 12:40-13:00Ian Heywood: "ASKAP (and MeerKAT)"
  • 13:00-13:45Lunch
  • 13:45-14:05Mike Garrett: "eMERLIN and the SKA"
  • 14:05-14:20Bojan Nikolic: "Hydrogen Epoch of Reionization Array: Description and Initial Commissioning Results"
  • 14:20-14:35Mario Bisi: "Solar, Heliospheric, and Ionospheric Science Highlights from LOFAR and the MWA: Towards the SKA"
  • 14:35-14:50Emma Chapman: "Changing the SKA-Low maximum baseline: impact on EoR science"
  • 14:50-15:05Chris Hales: "A next-generation VLA (ngVLA)"
  • 15:05-15:20Nicolina Chrysaphi: "Solar spectroscopic imaging from LOFAR to SKA"
  • 15:20-15:45Tea
  • 15:45-17:00Ian Robson: "STFC's Strategic Review of Radio Astronomy" followed by discussion of UK Radio Astronomy strategy
